messageBody:
RE: [junit] Re: Best practice with EJB

George Dinwiddie wrote:
> Coming back to an old topic, were you using container-managed
> or bean-managed persistence, here?
>
> The reason I ask is that my project has now mandated EJB 2.0
> CMP and I'm trying to figure out how I can create instantiable
> objects with the business logic, when access to the persistent
> fields are all abstract methods.

I'm using CMP.

The trick is that my local implementation declares the methods as non-abstract, then the EJB implementation (descended from it) redeclares them as abstract.

Robert.
